text:
src/include/http_config.h goes to the trouble of adding declaring its contents
extern "C" when included by a C++ file, yet it cannot actually be used like that
because the prototype for ap_merge_per_dir_configs() has a parameter named
"new", which is a keyword in C++.
creator: zilla@kayari.org
zilla@kayari.org
text:
Created attachment 16209
Rename parameter to allow inclusion in C++ files

This patch would allow http_config.h to be included from C++ files.

This would allow my employer to drop a local patch that we apply to the
upstream apache sources.
This problem doesn't appear to exist on trunk.
creator: slive@apache.org
zilla@kayari.org
text:
Erm, the report is for version 1.3, so looking on trunk is irrelevant.

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/httpd/httpd/branches/1.3.x/src/include/http_config.h?view=markup
shows 
CORE_EXPORT(void *) ap_merge_per_dir_configs(pool *p, void *base, void *new);

re-opening.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Getting very-minor things like this fixed on 1.3 is unlikely, since this version
is long-obsolete. But I'll leave it open if it makes you happy.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
If I kept a 1.3 tree, I'd fix it, 'cos it's so trivial.  But I don't, and a full
svn co is more trouble than 1.3 is worth.

Will your C++ compiler accept:
#define new foobar
#include <offending-file.h>
#undef new

creator: zilla@kayari.org
text:
well if it will just stay open and not get fixed then I guess you might as well
close it again, though WONTFIX might be more appropriate than FIXED.

yes, the macro hack will work.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Won't fix would be a better answer if we said no.

Nobody's said no, so the right answer is to leave it open.  If we were
really saying no more 1.3 release ever, we'd mass-close these.

Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>). Since this bug seems to affect only 1.3.x, I'm closing it as WONTFIX.

If this bug still affects you in a recent version (version 2.2.x or the upcoming version 2.4), please open a new bug.

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
